alert.note: Alert for Marin; Napa; Sonoma (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 29 at 3:00PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: .Heavier rain will move through portions of Sonoma County shortly and will persist through the evening today. Some reports of roadway flooding are already coming in and additional rainfall this evening will likely create more urban and small stream flooding across Sonoma County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, Marin, Napa and Sonoma. * WHEN...Until 700 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 257 PM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Roadway flooding already being reported near Forestville along SR 116. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Rosa, Petaluma, Rohnert Park, Windsor, Healdsburg, Cloverdale, Sebastopol, Cotati, Calistoga, Larkfield-Wikiup, Roseland, South Santa Rosa Cdp, Tomales, Dillon Beach, Boyes Hot Springs, Forestville, Guerneville, Monte Rio, Graton and Occidental. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
